summary:
South Tyrol is a special province in northern Italy with its own rules and powers. It's officially called the Autonomous Province of Bolzano – South Tyrol and is home to around 534,000 people. The capital is Bolzano. Most people here speak German, but many also speak Italian or Ladin.

This province is unique because it has a lot of independence and keeps most of its earnings. It's also very rich compared to other places in Italy and Europe. South Tyrol, along with Trentino, forms a special region called Trentino-Alto Adige/Südtirol.
title: South Tyrol
